posts.post_content: after searching for and trying many auras and equipment, [Favor of the Overbeing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Favor of the Overbeing) and [Infiltrator's Magemark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infiltrator's Magemark) seem the most efficient way to ensure a healthy draw inside the ![Green or Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=GU&type=symbol) color scheme. if anybody knows of another *permanent* way to do that in ANY color, i'd love to know about it. seriously. i think the main goal is to do it for 3 mana or less, though, if you've got 5 mana to spend on a [Gigantiform](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gigantiform), it's probably too late for the card advantage to make a big difference.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
One of the flagship cards for ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol), the colors of card draw and sneaky creatures. Give her a sword of your choice and you're good to go.  
The selkies were a great addition to the merfolk stable, in my opinion. Clever design, managing to be both cute and creepy, as well as introducing new color to merfolk.

Posted By: dantcg (4/23/2009 5:39:09 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
To anyone comparing the art to "The Ring" or stuff like it - Peg Prowler and Jenny Greenteeth have been around far longer than any Asian horror knock-offs. Come now.  
  
That said, a great and fun card. In a deck with Lorescale Coatl, she can be a 3-mana finisher. Everything she needs she can be given by the colors she's in. Need an island on your opponent's side of the board? You're playing blue. Want to draw more than one card per swing? You're playing green. Need to protect her from targeted removal? ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) can give its creatures all sorts of shroud without blinking twice, not to mention counterspells. A fantastic support card, at the very least. I don't know whey she's rated below a 4.5.
posts.html:
To anyone comparing the art to "The Ring" or stuff like it - Peg Prowler and Jenny Greenteeth have been around far longer than any Asian horror knock-offs. Come now.

That said, a great and fun card. In a deck with Lorescale Coatl, she can be a 3-mana finisher. Everything she needs she can be given by the colors she's in. Need an island on your opponent's side of the board? You're playing blue. Want to draw more than one card per swing? You're playing green. Need to protect her from targeted removal? can give its creatures all sorts of shroud without blinking twice, not to mention counterspells. A fantastic support card, at the very least. I don't know whey she's rated below a 4.5.

posts.post_content: @kronos539: Best way is [Aquitect's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aquitect's Will) by a mile. {U} cost, cantrips, makes your Selkie unblockable, can be cast BEFORE the Selkie if you so desire (possibly at the cost of the cantrip though). Only real downside is that it can't be adapted to be useful for non-islandwalkers. (Then you can spend the rest of your mana budget on pump if you so desire)
